017package org.microbean.type;
018
019import java.lang.reflect.Array;
020import java.lang.reflect.GenericArrayType;
021import java.lang.reflect.ParameterizedType;
022import java.lang.reflect.Type;
023import java.lang.reflect.TypeVariable;
024import java.lang.reflect.WildcardType;
025
026import java.util.Collection;
027import java.util.Collections;
028import java.util.Comparator;
029import java.util.HashMap;
030import java.util.HashSet;
031import java.util.LinkedHashSet;
032import java.util.Map;
033import java.util.Objects;
034import java.util.Set;
035
036import java.util.function.Function;
037import java.util.function.Predicate;
038
039/**
040 * A hub for Java {@link Type}-related operations.
041 *
042 * @author <a href="https://about.me/lairdnelson"
043 * target="_parent">Laird Nelson</a>
044 *
045 * @see #toTypes(Type)
046 *
047 * @threadsafety Instances of this class are safe for concurrent use
048 * by multiple threads.
049 */
050public final class Types {
051
052
053  /*
054   * Static fields.
055   */
056
057  
058  static final Comparator<Type> typeNameComparator = new TypeNameComparator();
059
060  private static final Map<Type, Type> wrapperTypes;
061
062  static {
063    final Map<Type, Type> map = new HashMap<>();
064    map.put(boolean.class, Boolean.class);
065    map.put(byte.class, Byte.class);
066    map.put(char.class, Character.class);
067    map.put(double.class, Double.class);
068    map.put(float.class, Float.class);
069    map.put(int.class, Integer.class);
070    map.put(long.class, Long.class);
071    map.put(short.class, Short.class);
072    map.put(void.class, Void.class);
073    wrapperTypes = Collections.unmodifiableMap(map);
074  }
075
076
077  /*
078   * Constructors.
079   */
080
081  
082  /**
083   * Creates a new {@link Types}.
084   */
085  private Types() {
086    super();
087  }
088
089  
090  /*
091   * Methods.
092   */
093
094
095  /**
096   * For the vast majority of cases, returns the supplied {@link Type}
097   * unchanged, but in the case where a raw {@link Class} is supplied,
098   * returns an equivalent {@link ParameterizedType} whose {@linkplain
099   * ParameterizedType#getActualTypeArguments() actual type arguments}
100   * are not resolved.
101   *
102   * @param type the {@link Type} to normalize; may be {@code null} in
103   * which case {@code null} will be returned; will often be returned
104   * unchanged
105   *
106   * @return the normalized {@link Type}; {@code null} if {@code type}
107   * was {@code null}
108   *
109   * @nullability This method may return {@code null} only if the
110   * supplied {@link Type} is {@code null}.
111   *
112   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
113   * threads.
114   */
115  public static final Type normalize(final Type type) {
116    final Type returnValue;
117    if (type instanceof Class<?> cls) {
118      final Type[] typeParameters = cls.getTypeParameters();
119      if (typeParameters == null || typeParameters.length <= 0) {
120        final Type componentType = cls.getComponentType();
121        if (componentType == null) {
122          returnValue = type;
123        } else {
124          final Type normalizedComponentType = normalize(componentType); // XXX recursive
125          if (componentType == normalizedComponentType) {
126            returnValue = type;
127          } else {
128            returnValue = new DefaultGenericArrayType(normalizedComponentType);
129          }
130        }
131      } else {
132        returnValue = new DefaultParameterizedType(cls.getDeclaringClass(), cls, typeParameters);
133      }
134    } else {
135      returnValue = type;
136    }
137    return returnValue;
138  }
139
140  /*
141   * Bookmark: resolve(Type)
142   */
143
144  /**
145   * Resolves the supplied {@link Type} and returns the result.
146   *
147   * @param type the {@link Type} to resolve; may be {@code null}
148   *
149   * @param typeResolver the {@link Function} whose {@link
150   * Function#apply(Object)} method will be called on, among other
151   * things, {@link ParameterizedType} {@linkplain
152   * ParameterizedType#getActualTypeArguments() type arguments}; must
153   * not be {@code null}
154   *
155   * @return the resolved {@link Type}, or {@code null}
156   *
157   * @nullability This method may return {@code null}.
158   *
159   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
160   * threads.
161   *
162   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
163   */
164  public static final Type resolve(final Type type, final Function<? super Type, ? extends Type> typeResolver) {
165    final Type returnValue;
166    if (type instanceof Class<?> cls) {
167      returnValue = resolve(cls, typeResolver);
168    } else if (type instanceof ParameterizedType parameterizedType) {
169      returnValue = resolve(parameterizedType, typeResolver);
170    } else if (type instanceof GenericArrayType genericArrayType) {
171      returnValue = resolve(genericArrayType, typeResolver);
172    } else if (type instanceof TypeVariable<?> typeVariable) {
173      returnValue = resolve(typeVariable, typeResolver);
174    } else if (type instanceof WildcardType wildcardType) {
175      // (No-op.)
176      returnValue = resolve(wildcardType, typeResolver);
177    } else {
178      // (Unknown type, so we don't know how to resolve it.)
179      returnValue = type;
180    }
181    return returnValue;
182  }
183
184  private static final Type resolve(final Class<?> type, final Function<? super Type, ? extends Type> typeResolver) {
185    final Type candidate = typeResolver.apply(type);
186    return candidate == null ? type : candidate;
187  }
188
189  private static final Type resolve(final ParameterizedType type, final Function<? super Type, ? extends Type> typeResolver) {
190    final Type candidate = typeResolver.apply(type);
191    if (candidate == null) {
192      final Type[] actualTypeArguments = type.getActualTypeArguments();
193      final int length = actualTypeArguments.length;
194      final Type[] resolvedActualTypeArguments = new Type[length];
195      boolean createNewType = false;
196      for (int i = 0; i < length; i++) {
197        final Type actualTypeArgument = actualTypeArguments[i];
198        final Type resolvedActualTypeArgument = resolve(actualTypeArgument, typeResolver);
199        resolvedActualTypeArguments[i] = resolvedActualTypeArgument;
200        if (actualTypeArgument != resolvedActualTypeArgument) {
201          // If they're not the same object reference, then resolution
202          // did something, so we have to return a new type, not the
203          // one we were handed.
204          createNewType = true;
205        }
206      }
207      return createNewType ? new DefaultParameterizedType(type.getOwnerType(), type.getRawType(), resolvedActualTypeArguments) : type;
208    } else {
209      return candidate;
210    }
211
212  }
213
214  private static final Type resolve(final GenericArrayType type, final Function<? super Type, ? extends Type> typeResolver) {
215    final Type returnValue;
216    final Type candidate = typeResolver.apply(type);
217    if (candidate == null) {
218      final Type genericComponentType = type.getGenericComponentType();
219      final Type resolvedComponentType = resolve(genericComponentType, typeResolver);
220      assert resolvedComponentType != null;
221      if (resolvedComponentType == genericComponentType) {
222        // Identity means that basically resolution was a no-op, so the
223        // genericComponentType was whatever it was, and so we are going
224        // to be a no-op as well.
225        returnValue = type;
226      } else if (resolvedComponentType instanceof Class<?> componentType) {
227        // This might happen when genericComponentType was a
228        // TypeVariable.  In this case, it might get resolved to a
229        // simple scalar (e.g. Integer.class).  Now we have,
230        // effectively, a GenericArrayType whose genericComponentType is
231        // just a plain class.  That's actually just an ordinary Java
232        // array, so "resolve" this type by returning its array
233        // equivalent.
234        returnValue = Array.newInstance(componentType, 0).getClass();
235      } else {
236        // If we get here, we know that resolution actually did
237        // something, so return a new GenericArrayType implementation
238        // whose component type is the resolved version of the
239        // original's.
240        returnValue = new DefaultGenericArrayType(resolvedComponentType);
241      }
242    } else {
243      returnValue = candidate;
244    }
245    return returnValue;
246  }
247
248  private static final Type resolve(final TypeVariable<?> type, final Function<? super Type, ? extends Type> typeResolver) {
249    final Type candidate = typeResolver.apply(type);
250    return candidate == null ? type : candidate;
251  }
252
253  private static final Type resolve(final WildcardType type, final Function<? super Type, ? extends Type> typeResolver) {
254    final Type candidate = typeResolver.apply(type);
255    return candidate == null ? type : candidate;
256  }
257
258
259  /*
260   * Bookmark: toTypes(Type)
261   */
262
263
264  /**
265   * Returns a non-{@code null}, {@linkplain
266   * Collections#unmodifiableSet(Set) unmodifiable <code>Set</code>}
267   * of {@link Type}s, each element of which is a {@link Type} which
268   * any instance bearing the supplied {@link Type} will implement.
269   *
270   * <p>The {@link Set} that is returned is guaranteed to not contain
271   * {@link WildcardType} or {@link TypeVariable} instances.</p>
272   *
273   * @param type the {@link Type} whose type closure should be
274   * computed; may be {@code null}
275   *
276   * @return a non-{@code null} {@link TypeSet} <code>Set</code>} of
277   * {@link Type}s; the supplied {@link Type} will be one of its
278   * elements unless it is a {@link TypeVariable} or a {@link
279   * WildcardType}
280   *
281   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
282   *
283   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
284   * threads.
285   *
286   * @idempotency This method is idempotent.
287   *
288   * @see #toTypes(Type, Predicate)
289   */
290  public static final TypeSet toTypes(final Type type) {
291    return toTypes(type, null);
292  }
293
294  /**
295   * Returns a non-{@code null}, {@linkplain
296   * Collections#unmodifiableSet(Set) unmodifiable <code>Set</code>}
297   * of {@link Type}s, each element of which is a {@link Type} which
298   * any instance bearing the supplied {@link Type} will implement.
299   *
300   * <p>The {@link Set} that is returned is guaranteed to not contain
301   * {@link WildcardType} or {@link TypeVariable} instances.</p>
302   *
303   * <p>If the supplied {@link Predicate} returns {@code true} from an
304   * invocation of its {@link Predicate#test(Object)} method, then the
305   * {@link Type} that was passed to it will not be contained by the
306   * returned {@link TypeSet}.</p>
307   *
308   * @param type the {@link Type} whose type closure should be
309   * computed; may be {@code null}
310   *
311   * @param removalPredicate a {@link Predicate} used to selectively
312   * remove some {@link Type}s from the computed {@link TypeSet}; may
313   * be {@code null}
314   *
315   * @return a non-{@code null} {@link TypeSet} <code>Set</code>} of
316   * {@link Type}s, filtered by the supplied {@link Predicate}
317   *
318   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
319   *
320   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
321   * threads.
322   *
323   * @idempotency This method is idempotent.
324   */
325  public static final TypeSet toTypes(final Type type, Predicate<? super Type> removalPredicate) {
326    final Map<Type, Type> resolvedTypes = new HashMap<>();
327    toTypes(type, isRawClass(type), resolvedTypes);
328    resolvedTypes.keySet()
329      .removeIf(k -> !(k instanceof Class) || removalPredicate != null && removalPredicate.test(resolvedTypes.get(k)));
330    return new TypeSet(resolvedTypes.values());
331  }
332
333  private static final void toTypes(final Type type,
334                                    final boolean noParameterizedTypes,
335                                    final Map<Type, Type> resolvedTypes) {
336    if (type == null) {
337      // Do nothing on purpose
338    } else if (type instanceof Class<?> cls) {
339      toTypes(cls, noParameterizedTypes, resolvedTypes);
340    } else if (type instanceof ParameterizedType parameterizedType) {
341      toTypes(parameterizedType, noParameterizedTypes, resolvedTypes);
342    } else if (type instanceof GenericArrayType genericArrayType) {
343      toTypes(genericArrayType, noParameterizedTypes, resolvedTypes);
344    } else if (type instanceof TypeVariable<?> typeVariable) {
345      // Do nothing on purpose
346    } else if (type instanceof WildcardType wildcardType) {
347      // Do nothing on purpose
348    } else {
349      throw new IllegalArgumentException("Unexpected type: " + type);
350    }
351  }
352
353  private static final void toTypes(final Class<?> type,
354                                    final boolean noParameterizedTypes,
355                                    final Map<Type, Type> resolvedTypes) {
356    resolvedTypes.put(type, resolve(type, resolvedTypes::get));
357    final Type superclass = noParameterizedTypes ? type.getSuperclass() : type.getGenericSuperclass();
358    if (superclass != null) {
359      toTypes(superclass, noParameterizedTypes, resolvedTypes);
360    }
361    final Type[] interfaces = noParameterizedTypes ? type.getInterfaces() : type.getGenericInterfaces();
362    for (int i = 0; i < interfaces.length; i++) {
363      toTypes(interfaces[i], noParameterizedTypes, resolvedTypes);
364    }
365  }
366
367  private static final void toTypes(final ParameterizedType type,
368                                    final boolean noParameterizedTypes,
369                                    final Map<Type, Type> resolvedTypes) {
370    final Class<?> rawType = toClass(type);
371    if (rawType != null) {
372      final TypeVariable<?>[] typeVariables = rawType.getTypeParameters();
373      final Type[] typeVariableValues = type.getActualTypeArguments();
374      assert typeVariables.length == typeVariableValues.length;
375      for (int i = 0; i < typeVariables.length; i++) {
376        resolvedTypes.put(typeVariables[i], resolve(typeVariableValues[i], resolvedTypes::get));
377      }
378      resolvedTypes.put(rawType, resolve(type, resolvedTypes::get));
379      toTypes(rawType, noParameterizedTypes, resolvedTypes);
380    }
381  }
382
383  private static final void toTypes(final GenericArrayType type,
384                                    final boolean noParameterizedTypes,
385                                    final Map<Type, Type> resolvedTypes) {
386    final Class<?> rawType = toClass(type);
387    if (rawType != null) {
388      final Class<?> arrayType = Array.newInstance(rawType, 0).getClass();
389      resolvedTypes.put(arrayType, type);
390      toTypes(arrayType, noParameterizedTypes, resolvedTypes);
391    }
392  }
393
394  /**
395   * Returns the result of <a
396   * href="https://docs.oracle.com/javase/specs/jls/se13/html/jls-5.html#jls-5.1.7">boxing
397   * conversion</a> on the supplied {@link Type}.
398   *
399   * <p>In most cases this means the supplied {@link Type} is returned
400   * unchanged.</p>
401   *
402   * <p>This method calls {@link #isPrimitive(Type)} as part of its
403   * execution.</p>
404   *
405   * @param <T> the kind of {@link Type} in question
406   *
407   * @param type the {@link Type} to test
408   *
409   * @return the result of <a
410   * href="https://docs.oracle.com/javase/specs/jls/se13/html/jls-5.html#jls-5.1.7">boxing
411   * conversion</a> on the supplied {@link Type}
412   *
413   * @nullability This method will return {@code null} if {@code type}
414   * is {@code null}.
415   *
416   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
417   * threads.
418   *
419   * @idempotency This method is idempotent.
420   *
421   * @see #isPrimitive(Type)
422   */
423  @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
424  public static final <T extends Type> T box(final T type) {
425    // We don't just blindly look up in wrapperTypes.  We call
426    // isPrimitive() first to potentially avoid the Map lookup.
427    return isPrimitive(type) ? (T)wrapperTypes.getOrDefault(type, type) : type;
428  }
429
430  /**
431   * Returns {@code true} if and only if {@code type} is a {@link
432   * Class} and {@linkplain Class#isPrimitive() is primitive}.
433   *
434   * @param type the {@link Type} to test; may be {@code null} in
435   * which case {@code false} will be returned
436   *
437   * @return {@code true} if and only if {@code type} is a {@link
438   * Class} and {@linkplain Class#isPrimitive() is primitive}
439   *
440   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
441   * threads.
442   *
443   * @idempotency This method is idempotent.
444   */
445  public static final boolean isPrimitive(final Type type) {
446    return type instanceof Class<?> cls && cls.isPrimitive();
447  }
448
449  /**
450   * Returns {@code true} if and only if the supplied {@link Type} is
451   * a raw {@link Class}.
452   *
453   * <p>This method returns {@code true} if:</p>
454   *
455   * <ul>
456   *
457   * <li>The supplied {@link Type} is an instance of {@link Class},
458   * and any of the following conditions is true:
459   *
460   * <ul>
461   *
462   * <li>The return value of invoking this method on the {@linkplain
463   * Class class}' {@linkplain Class#getComponentType() component
464   * type} is {@code true}</li>
465   *
466   * <li>The {@linkplain Class class} {@linkplain
467   * Class#getTypeParameters() has type parameters}</li>
468   *
469   * </ul>
470   *
471   * </li>
472   *
473   * </ul>
474   *
475   * @param type the {@link Type} in question; may be {@code null} in
476   * which case {@code false} will be returned
477   *
478   * @return {@code true} if if and only if the supplied {@link Type}
479   * is a raw {@link Class}
480   */
481  public static final boolean isRawClass(final Type type) {
482    return type instanceof Class<?> cls && (isRawClass(cls.getComponentType()) || cls.getTypeParameters().length > 0);
483  }
484
485  /**
486   * Does what is necessary to extract a {@link Class} from the
487   * supplied {@link Type} if at all possible.
488   *
489   * <ul>
490   *
491   * <li>If a {@link Class} is supplied, the {@link Class} is simply
492   * returned.</li>
493   *
494   * <li>If a {@link ParameterizedType} is supplied, the result of
495   * invoking {@link #toClass(Type)} on its {@linkplain
496   * ParameterizedType#getRawType() raw type} is returned.</li>
497   *
498   * <li>If a {@link GenericArrayType} is supplied, the result of
499   * invoking {@link #toClass(Type)} on its {@linkplain
500   * GenericArrayType#getGenericComponentType() generic component
501   * type} is returned.</li>
502   *
503   * <li>If a {@link TypeVariable} is supplied, the result of invoking
504   * {@link #toClass(Type)} on its {@linkplain
505   * TypeVariable#getBounds() first bound} is returned (if it has one)
506   * or {@link Object Object.class} if it does not.  <strong>Any other
507   * bounds are ignored.</strong></li>
508   *
509   * <li>If a {@link WildcardType} is supplied, the result of invoking
510   * {@link #toClass(Type)} on its {@linkplain
511   * WildcardType#getUpperBounds() first upper bound} is returned.
512   * <strong>Any other bounds are ignored.</strong></li>
513   *
514   * </ul>
515   *
516   * @param type the {@link Type} for which a {@link Class} is to be
517   * returned; may be {@code null} in which case {@code null} will be
518   * returned
519   *
520   * @return a {@link Class}, or {@code null} if a suitable raw type
521   * could not be determined
522   *
523   * @nullability This method may return {@code null}.
524   *
525   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by mutltiple
526   * threads.
527   *
528   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
529   */
530  public static final Class<?> toClass(final Type type) {
531    final Class<?> returnValue;
532    if (type == null) {
533      returnValue = null;
534    } else if (type instanceof Class<?> cls) {
535      returnValue = toClass(cls);
536    } else if (type instanceof ParameterizedType parameterizedType) {
537      returnValue = toClass(parameterizedType);
538    } else if (type instanceof GenericArrayType genericArrayType) {
539      returnValue = toClass(genericArrayType);
540    } else if (type instanceof TypeVariable<?> typeVariable) {
541      returnValue = toClass(typeVariable);
542    } else if (type instanceof WildcardType wildcardType) {
543      returnValue = toClass(wildcardType);
544    } else {
545      returnValue = null;
546    }
547    return returnValue;
548  }
549
550  private static final Class<?> toClass(final Class<?> type) {
551    return type;
552  }
553
554  private static final Class<?> toClass(final ParameterizedType type) {
555    return type == null ? null : toClass(type.getRawType());
556  }
557
558  private static final Class<?> toClass(final GenericArrayType type) {
559    final Class<?> candidate = type == null ? null : toClass(type.getGenericComponentType());
560    return candidate == null ? null : (Class<?>)Array.newInstance(candidate, 0).getClass();
561  }
562
563  private static final Class<?> toClass(final TypeVariable<?> type) {
564    final Type[] bounds = type == null ? null : type.getBounds();
565    return bounds != null && bounds.length > 0 ? toClass(bounds[0]) : Object.class;
566  }
567
568  private static final Class<?> toClass(final WildcardType type) {
569    final Type[] bounds = type == null ? null : type.getUpperBounds();
570    return bounds != null && bounds.length > 0 ? toClass(bounds[0]) : Object.class;
571  }
572
573
574  /*
575   * Inner and nested classes.
576   */
577
578
579  private static final class TypeNameComparator implements Comparator<Type> {
580
581    @Override
582    public final int compare(final Type t1, final Type t2) {
583      return t1.equals(t2) ? 0 : t1.getTypeName().compareTo(t2.getTypeName());
584    }
585
586  }
587
588}
